intro: Callipteris andina, commonly known as the Andean feathergrass, is a perennial grass native to the high altitudes of South America. It features slender, arching stems that bear feathery, silver-green foliage, giving it a delicate and ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its compact size and drought tolerance make it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Callipteris andina is valued for its ornamental beauty and adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
